topic.title: content path
topic.body:
Is there a way to change the path were all the content is being stored?
I don't want it on my small root partition.

1_13AvYD3hX888Ey6y8kFEce3Ak8hVNLcdrg.body:
Ok, will use a link then. I thought there would be an option to set the path in a config or as a prefix.
Thanks

> [nofish](#comment_443_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): you can also set it using --data_dir /somewhere/another/place or zeronet.conf:
> [global]
> data_dir = /somewhere/another/place

that's what I was looking for, thanks a lot

8_16w7UuJAHbt8YBa8zxHS7UFk9mq8Q5DpE4.body:
I think there is a difference between adblocking and torrenting.
Regarding adblocking:
I think most people aren't against adds in general but  against annoying pop up, full site, flashing and slowing adds. Which are the most adds a the moment. If you annoy your customers they won't visit your site or install an adblocker.
Same problem with torrenting:
If you annoy your customer they won't buy your product. I reckon the biggest problem the separation of the world in regions. If I can't get the content because I live in country x, it's more likely to get pirated. Same goes for ease of consumption If I have to install apps and Stuff to view things it's easier to pirate them.
So give people an easy way to get your content and they will.
